docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 23 Government sources said today that there were no plans for a meeting between President Johnson or his senior officials there and Maj. Gen. Anastasio Somoza Debayle, Presidentelect of Nicaragua. General Somoza is in New York on a...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 23 Government sources said today that there were no plans for a meeting between President Johnson or his senior officials there and Maj. Gen. Anastasio Somoza Debayle, Presidentelect of Nicaragua. General Somoza is in New York on a "private" visit.

docs.lead_paragraph: HANOVER, N.H. EARLY in February the 3,000 students hibernating on Dartmouth's snowy campus were surprised to find a mimeographed sheet headed "THE GREAT DAY" tacked to all public bulletin boards. It began, "Men of Dartmouth: Four hundred girls from Colby Jr., Mt. Holyoke, Smith and Weliesley are coming to Hanover on Saturday March 4, strongly spurted by a desire to discuss a book with you..."

docs.lead_paragraph: Sol M. Linowitz, United States representative at the Organization of American States, said yesterday that the United States should make clear its preference for progressive, democratic governments over military regimes in Latin America through acts of "special friendship."
